newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN OLOS GET M3 BOOST,DISMISS UPCOMING AUCTION.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN OLOS GET M3 BOOST,DISMISS UPCOMING AUCTION.

text.p: Belgian linear bonds barely noticed any downward pressure from the OLO exchange auction later on Tuesday and were pulled higher by Bunds following good July M3 data, dealers said.
"M3 were better than expected, now a German rate rise has again become more unlikely," one dealer said. "Economically speaking it just would not make any sense," he said.
The 10-year OLO/Bund yield spread was unchanged at nine basis points.
Today's meeting of the U.S. policy making Federal Open Market Committee was not a factor to be reckoned with, he added.
One dealer said the 2002 and 2003 area was slightly affected by the prospect of the exchange auction today and regular monthly auction next week.
"Some people are perhaps already selling a bit because they are confident of getting the paper back during the exchange," he said.
He noted the OLO yield curve stubbornly refused to steepen despite the decreased pressure from the dollar. "There are still worries about whether (the dollar) will rise again,' he said.
